means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 佩珀职业名称，经营香料者，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“胡椒”(pepper)

word_mean: 胡椒：黑胡椒学名piper nigrum(胡椒科)及该属其它植物的未熟干果。白胡椒为去皮的成熟黑胡椒的果实，性较温和。胡椒含胡椒碱，一种芳香性具刺激味的挥发油(5～9％)，少许其它生物碱以及脂肪，蛋白质和树脂
主要用做香料，但也有发汗，驱风和促使胃液分泌的作用

sentence.Network_en: Season with salt, pepper and a pinch of cayenne.
sentence.Network_cn: 调以盐、胡椒和少许辣椒粉。

sentence.Network_en: She sprinkled pepper on my grub, watching me nosh.
sentence.Network_cn: 她在我的食物上撒了点胡椒粉，看着我吃。

sentence.Network_en: Roll the meat in coarsely ground black pepper to season it.
sentence.Network_cn: 将肉在粗研的黑胡椒粉里滚一下以调味。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English piper, pipor, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch peper and German Pfeffer; via Latin from Greek peperi, from Sanskrit pippali 'berry, peppercorn'

encyclopedia.content: pepper胡椒；辣椒 pepper英音：['pepə]美音：['pɛpɚ] 名词 n. 1. 胡椒粉；辣椒粉；香辛调味品[U] I'd like to add some pepper to the bean curd. 我想在豆腐里加一点辣椒粉。2. 【植】胡椒；辣椒[C] I bought some green peppers for the salad. 我买了些青辣椒做色拉。3. 辛辣性，尖刻性[U]4.活力，劲头；胆量[U] There was plenty of pepper left in the old man. 这老人仍然精力充沛。 及物动词 v

entry.def: Pepper is a hot-tasting spice which is used to flavour food.
A pepper, or in American English a bell pepper, is a hollow green, red, or yellow vegetable with seeds inside it.

entry.tran: （小物体）密集地击打，连续击打
entry.def: If something is peppered with small objects, a lot of those objects hit it.

example.ex: He was wounded in both legs and severely peppered with shrapnel...
example.tran: 他两条腿都挂彩了，人也被如雨的弹片炸成重伤。

example.ex: Suddenly the garden was peppered with pellets.

entry.def: If something is peppered with things, it has a lot of those things in it or on it.

example.ex: While her English was correct, it was peppered with French phrases...
example.tran: 她的英语语法上没错，但是里面夹杂着很多法语短语。

example.ex: Outside, the road was peppered with glass...
example.tran: 屋外，马路上尽是些玻璃碴。

means.word_mean: 1. climber having dark red berries (peppercorns) when fully ripe; southern India and Sri Lanka; naturalized in northern Burma and Assam
2. any of various tropical plants of the genus Capsicum bearing peppers
3. pungent seasoning from the berry of the common pepper plant of East India; use whole or ground
4. sweet and hot varieties of fruits of plants of the genus Capsicum
2. attack and bombard with or as if with missiles;

list.explanation: (=pepper and salt)(吸毒者用语)含杂质的或劣质的大麻

example.en: This salt and pepper is oregano, I think.
example.zh: 我有这种含杂质的大麻是牛至吐粉。

auth_sentence.content: Sprinkle with salt and a few grinds of pepper.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sprinkle with salt and a few grinds of pepper.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sprinkle with salt and a few grinds of pepper.

auth_sentence.content: Season with more salt and freshly ground black pepper.
auth_sentence.res_content: Season with more salt and freshly ground black pepper.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Season with more salt and freshly ground black pepper.

auth_sentence.content: Season with salt and white pepper and keep warm.
auth_sentence.res_content: Season with salt and white pepper and keep warm.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Season with salt and white pepper and keep warm.

Sentence.sentence: Bell peppers stuffed with couscous, alongside ratatouille, is a very popular dish.

sentences.en: He put some pepper in the bowl.
sentences.cn: 他放了一些胡椒粉在碗里。

sentences.en: She takes a few peppers in the hand.
sentences.cn: 她拿了一些辣椒在手里。

means.word_mean: 在…上撒胡椒粉; 使布满
以…密击, 接二连三地提问

sentences.en: They peppered the enemy's lines with their shots.
sentences.cn: 他们用炮弹向敌人阵地密击。

sentences.en: Members of the city council peppered him with questions about the details of his plan.
sentences.cn: 市议员们对他计划的详情问个不休。

jushi.english: She takes a few peppers in the hand.
jushi.chinese: 她拿了一些辣椒在手里。

jushi.english: He put some pepper in the bowl.
jushi.chinese: 他放了一些胡椒粉在碗里。

jushi.english: The deer fell wounded, peppered with shot.
jushi.chinese: 这只鹿被击伤跌倒在地。
